titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase and modify the exclusion relating to qualified small business stock and to provide that the exclusion relating to incentive stock options will no longer be a minimum tax preference.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 6/28/2001--Introduced. Increases from 50 to 100 percent the amount of gain excluded from the sale of certain small business stock. Reduces from five to three years the holding period applicable to such a sale. Makes such exclusion available to corporations. Makes the stock of larger businesses eligible.Repeals the minimum tax preference for the exclusion for incentive stock options.
